Text.Value: A road that leads me straight to a hag's den, alas. But I wish you well. Be safe.
May your road be kind.
It's my pleasure. Really.
True. And I have no proof to offer but my word.
What?

EditorData.NodeContext: Realises his vampire pray is standing in front of him, in the sun.

Text.Value: I had my reasons, you can be sure of that.
Time for us to go! Good luck with your quest.
Interesting. Astarion, what do you think?
He was spinning a tale, and you were falling for it. Vampires? Sacred missions? Honestly.
It's amazing you survived, travelling with a beast like that.
These days, I'm making the impossible look easy.
Next time, warn me before you murder someone.
You idiot. What have you done?

EditorData.NodeContext: Furious

Text.Value: I absolutely, definitely will think about it.
Relax, he's not taking you anywhere.

EditorData.logicalname: Alias (HasMet with Astarion, Astarion still present)

Text.Value: It wasn't a good experience.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Astarion pulls the dagger loose and lets the corpse fall to the floor.
EditorData.NodeContext: You've just stabbed your nemesis in the eye with a dagger. You pull it loose as he slumps to the floor. This line follows on from 'I've crossed paths with his people before' -> (stabbing) -> it wasn't a good experience.

Text.Value: How do you capture a vampire, exactly?
I'm here to help. This is Astarion - the vampire you're hunting.
Ah, stranger. Forgive the aroma.
Be nice, Astarion. Gandrel here has been looking for you.
A just choice.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Standing over the unconcious body of Astarion.

Text.Value: Capture? And bring it where?
You're a monster hunter? I'm surprised - I thought all Gur were vagrant cut-throats.
I'll return him to my tribe, as ordered. Whatever fate awaits him there, I'm sure it is deserved.
[To Astarion] You're asking a lot of questions.
Everything all right?
It's a figure of speech, darling. I'd be disappointed if you trusted me at all.
Why not join us? We could use a monster hunter.
I've delivered a monster to a monster hunter.
We should go, but you have fun tracking your monster.

EditorData.NodeContext: 'We' referring to Astarion and the player. 'Monster' said with faint distain. You're talking about yourself.

Text.Value: His name is Astarion, but I fear he's gone to ground. I hope the hag of these lands can help me flush him out, if I can afford her blood price.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Astarion and the player exchange a look
EditorData.NodeContext: The hag's 'blood price' is likely to be something that'll cost him dearly.

Text.Value: What favour, exactly? He didn't need to die.
And when you find this 'Astarion'? You'll kill him?
Bigoted?! If you'd seen-

EditorData.NodeContext: Just been called bigoted. About to say "if you'd seen what they did to me", but thinks better of it

Text.Value: ...Tell me you had a good reason for that.
You treacherous little worm!
I said we'll be careful. Now let's go.
That bad, huh?
Do whatever you want.
I fear he's gone to ground. I hope the hag of these lands can help me flush him out, if I can afford her blood price.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Focus on Astarion here, he should visually react to the news that he's being hunted.
EditorData.NodeContext: The hag's 'blood price' is likely to be something that'll cost him dearly.

Text.Value: What?!

EditorData.NodeContext: Confused

Text.Value: Baldur's Gate. My people wait for me there.
Sure. Take him.
What'll you do when you find him? Kill the vampire?
*You catch a waft of something foul - metallic and sickly-sweet.*
I knew you were a jackass, but a racist? I'm shocked.
What the hells? He could have helped us!
Beyond that, I will say no more. There are some trade secrets we cannot share.
There, I'm afraid you're wrong.

EditorData.NodeContext: This line leads to combat.

Text.Value: A vampire spawn? Why?
Ignore the elf. He talks too much.
It isn't possible.
There's a lot to know.
Just so. Vampires are godless parasites - we do not need a reason to destroy them.
Cough and give Astarion a warning look.
Leave.
May I?

EditorData.NodeContext: To player - he's asking permission to kill the Gur hunter, and he's very keen.

Text.Value: Something terrifying, no doubt. Dragon? Cyclops? Kobold?

EditorData.NodeContext: Dragon and cyclops are huge and impressive, kobold is a runty little lizard creature.

Text.Value: It's yours. This is the only prize I need.
Say nothing.
That's Astarion? No. Impossible.

EditorData.NodeContext: You're looking at your vampire prey, standing in the sun

Text.Value: Astarion? No. It can't be.

EditorData.NodeContext: Realises his vampire pray is standing in front of him, in the sun. This line leads to combat.

Text.Value: I wish I had half the power settled folk think my people possess. Alas, I am a simple wanderer.
I thank you for your help. My people work to rid this world of evil - you are a friend to our cause.
It is a sacred mission from the head of my tribe. She sent me here to capture the beast and return it to her.
Fine. But if this comes back to bite us, it's on your head.
No! I mean - we have different quests. I wouldn't want to distract this fellow from his path any more than he'd want to lead us from ours.
I would have made a deal with the hag to find this. I'm very glad that I did not. Thank you and safe travels.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Gur Hunter walks away, carrying an unconcious Astarion. He needs to disappear from view before exiting the dialog.
EditorData.NodeContext: While carrying an unconcious body. 'Thank you' line spoken while looking at the player, then you turn and start walking away before calling back the second line.

Text.Value: Excellent.

EditorData.NodeContext: Said with hunger - you've just been given permission to kill someone you hate

Text.Value: Thank you for this. And for cleansing this swamp of the hag. You have done good here today. Safe travels.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Gur Hunter walks away, carrying an unconcious Astarion. He needs to disappear from view before exiting the dialog.
EditorData.NodeContext: While carrying an unconcious body. 'Thank you' line spoken while looking at the player, then you turn and start walking away before calling back the second line.

Text.Value: I'd like to trade.
You killed him because you're bigoted against his people?
The Gur help themselves, no one else. Whatever his price, it would've been too much.
What will happen to him?
Say nothing.
Powdered iron-vine. An old hunter's trick - most monsters will think twice before making a meal of me.
Trust me, I did us a favour.
A simple wanderer and monster hunter. But I'm no witchdoctor or cut-throat.

EditorData.NodeContext: Good humoured, with a laugh

Text.Value: How sensible.
Thank you for the warning, we'll be careful.
But in this case, it is a sacred mission from the head of my tribe. She sent me here to capture the beast and return it to her.
His name is Astarion, but I fear he's gone to ground. I was hoping the hag of these lands could help me flush him out, but it seems she is no more.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Astarion and the player exchange a look

Text.Value: Right, but very wrong. My prey is a vampire spawn - much less impressive than the beast that lives here.
Pardon, but who - or what - is a Gur?
He is right, unfortunately. They are only weak when compared to their masters.
Now, if we're done, we have more important business to get on with.
Only a spawn? Pity. Not like it's a real vampire.
No. No, we're done here. Let's go.

EditorData.NodeContext: Centering himself

Text.Value: That bad.
Nod.
We've all survived so far. Let's focus on that.
I assume you want to kill the hag?
At night, of course!
If you wish it, our paths need not cross again. I'm hunting a vampire spawn, and it is a little too bright for you to be my prey.
Take the spawn, just leave his stuff with me.
Is your friend ill? I have some tea that might help...

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Astarion is staring at the Gur Hunter

Text.Value: We steal your chickens, curse your crops, seduce your daughters - your friend here has heard it all, I'm sure.
Safe travels. And good luck.
Not this time. My orders are to capture him.
Say nothing.
Oh? And bring him where, exactly?
Well, I tried. Astarion? Kill the hunter.
During the day, we have the advantage. But at night, when they hunt? You will not find a more deadly quarry.
So what monster are you hunting?
Or to make a deal with her. Probably think you can outfox the old dear.
You're asking why a monster hunter would hunt a monster?
You've tracked me down again, my friend. Would that I had as much luck with the beast I'm hunting.
Don't you think we should do something about the... vampire issue?

EditorData.stateContext: No one knows Astarion is a vampire - he's hiding it from everyone

Text.Value: Indeed it is. We should do something about this threat.

EditorData.NodeContext: To player, referring to the threat the hunter poses, without alerting the hunter.

Text.Value: It would still be wise to post guards at night. The threat is real.
A mystical and dangerous people, we travel the land, never settling in one place.
We'll be careful, but we should get going.
May your road be kind.
Yes, I'm sure they can creep right up on you.
Yes, yes, fine. It's just - specific. Why not kill the gnolls or goblins rampaging around here?
I've crossed paths with your people before, you know.
Well, here he is. This is Astarion.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Gur Hunter knocks Astarion out while he's still focused on the player. The vampire collapses to the ground.

Text.Value: He would've followed us to camp and slit our throats in the night.
I fear he's gone to ground. I hoped the hag of these lands could help me flush him out, but it seems she is no more.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Focus on Astarion here, he should visually react to the news that he's being hunted.

Text.Value: No. No, I'm quite well.

EditorData.NodeContext: Coming back to yourself. You've been thinking about killing this guy, but the player has subtly warned you not to.

Text.Value: Trust you? After that?

EditorData.stateContext: Player and Astarion both know that Astarion is the vampire the Hunter is looking for.

Text.Value: All right, kill him if you must.
A more difficult road, now that the hag is gone, but perhaps a better one.
I have a cage ready nearby - it will hold him when he wakes.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Hunter pick up the unconcious Astarion, slinging him over his shoulder.
EditorData.NodeContext: Leans down to pick up the unconcious Astarion, slinging him over your shoulder.

Text.Value: What?

EditorData.NodeContext: Outraged

Text.Value: Wait - that's it? We're just walking away?
You should listen to your companion. Next he'll warn you that my people can curse your cow to give only sour milk and will seduce your daughter to a life of roaming.
And more! We steal chickens, curse your crops, seduce your daughters - the list goes on.
Your friend has just heard the rumours of my people. That we steal chickens, curse your crops, seduce your daughters...
The elf is right. I have my own road to walk.
I don't know. I'm sure a vampire spawn could still rip your throat out if he felt like it.
Please do. But the vampire spawn is staying with me.
The vampire? It can't be.

EditorData.NodeContext: Realises his vampire pray is standing in front of him, in the sun. This line leads to combat.

Text.Value: But I wish you well. Be safe.
Go in peace, my friends. I pray our paths cross again.
If I were a cut-throat, I wouldn't admit it either.
*Under all the smiles, you can feel Astarion's tension. He's coiled like a spring, hand inching towards his weapon.*
Let's go, we've wasted enough time talking.
Fine. This is Astarion, the vampire spawn you're hunting.
Nothing so dramatic. I'm hunting for a vampire spawn.
Thank you. Treating with a hag, I need all the luck I can get.
Don't do this. No one needs to die.
They'd better bloody not.

EditorData.NodeContext: Muttered while walking away. Response to 'I hope our paths cross again'

Text.Value: No, we're going to leave in peace.

Synopsis: Gandrel is a monster hunter we encounter outside the Hag's lair. He's pleasant, cheerful, and a little eccentric - but shows his experience and expertise when warning us about the hag. He's affable and unassuming, but shows moments of steel when discussing his quarry (Astarion, although he doesn't realise his quarry is standing in front of him.) At first Astarion thinks its funny to meet a monster hunter (as he's a monster) but turns sour when he discovers that he's the target.
